revised_title: Electrical Responses of the Auditory Mechanism in Cold-Blooded Vertebrates
tldr: The authors studied the electrical response of the auditory mechanism in cold-blooded vertebrates, such as alligators, tortoises, frogs, and eels. They discovered that the electrical oscillations in these animals' ears contribute to the response recorded from the auditory nerve. The results provide insights into the cochlear potentials and the mechanism of sensory endings in the vertebrate auditory system.
